00001 /*
00002  * exp.h
00003  * The basic idea is to exploit Pade polynomials.
00004  * A lot of ideas were inspired by the cephes math library (by Stephen L.
00005  * Moshier
00006  * moshier@na-net.ornl.gov) as well as actual code.
00007  * The Cephes library can be found here:  http://www.netlib.org/cephes/
00008  *
00009  *  Created on: Jun 23, 2012
00010  *      Author: Danilo Piparo, Thomas Hauth, Vincenzo Innocente
00011  */

00028 #ifndef _VDT_EXP_
00029 #define _VDT_EXP_

00031 #include "vdtcore_common.h"
00032 #include <limits>

00034 namespace vdt {
00035 
00036     namespace details {
00037 
00038         const double EXP_LIMIT = 708;
00039 
00040         const double PX1exp = 1.26177193074810590878E-4;
00041         const double PX2exp = 3.02994407707441961300E-2;
00042         const double PX3exp = 9.99999999999999999910E-1;
00043         const double QX1exp = 3.00198505138664455042E-6;
00044         const double QX2exp = 2.52448340349684104192E-3;
00045         const double QX3exp = 2.27265548208155028766E-1;
00046         const double QX4exp = 2.00000000000000000009E0;
00047 
00048         const double LOG2E = 1.4426950408889634073599; // 1/log(2)
00049 
00050         const float MAXLOGF = 88.72283905206835f;
00051         const float MINLOGF = -88.f;
00052 
00053         const float C1F = 0.693359375f;
00054         const float C2F = -2.12194440e-4f;
00055 
00056         const float PX1expf = 1.9875691500E-4f;
00057         const float PX2expf = 1.3981999507E-3f;
00058         const float PX3expf = 8.3334519073E-3f;
00059         const float PX4expf = 4.1665795894E-2f;
00060         const float PX5expf = 1.6666665459E-1f;
00061         const float PX6expf = 5.0000001201E-1f;
00062 
00063         const float LOG2EF = 1.44269504088896341f;
00064     }
00065 
00066     // Exp double precision
00067     // --------------------------------------------------------
00068 
00070     inline double fast_exp(double initial_x) {
00071 
00072         double x = initial_x;
00073         double px = details::fpfloor(details::LOG2E * x + 0.5);
00074 
00075         const int32_t n = int32_t(px);
00076 
00077         x -= px * 6.93145751953125E-1;
00078         x -= px * 1.42860682030941723212E-6;
00079 
00080         const double xx = x * x;
00081 
00082         // px = x * P(x**2).
00083         px = details::PX1exp;
00084         px *= xx;
00085         px += details::PX2exp;
00086         px *= xx;
00087         px += details::PX3exp;
00088         px *= x;
00089 
00090         // Evaluate Q(x**2).
00091         double qx = details::QX1exp;
00092         qx *= xx;
00093         qx += details::QX2exp;
00094         qx *= xx;
00095         qx += details::QX3exp;
00096         qx *= xx;
00097         qx += details::QX4exp;
00098 
00099         // e**x = 1 + 2x P(x**2)/( Q(x**2) - P(x**2) )
00100         x = px / (qx - px);
00101         x = 1.0 + 2.0 * x;
00102 
00103         // Build 2^n in double.
00104         x *= details::uint642dp((((uint64_t)n) + 1023) << 52);
00105 
00106         if (initial_x > details::EXP_LIMIT)
00107             x = std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity();
00108         if (initial_x < -details::EXP_LIMIT)
00109             x = 0.;
00110 
00111         return x;
00112     }
00113 
00114     // Exp single precision
00115     // --------------------------------------------------------
00116 
00118     inline float fast_expf(float initial_x) {
00119 
00120         float x = initial_x;
00121 
00122         float z =
00123             details::fpfloor(details::LOG2EF * x +
00124                              0.5f); /* floor() truncates toward -infinity. */
00125 
00126         x -= z * details::C1F;
00127         x -= z * details::C2F;
00128         const int32_t n = int32_t(z);
00129 
00130         const float x2 = x * x;
00131 
00132         z = x * details::PX1expf;
00133         z += details::PX2expf;
00134         z *= x;
00135         z += details::PX3expf;
00136         z *= x;
00137         z += details::PX4expf;
00138         z *= x;
00139         z += details::PX5expf;
00140         z *= x;
00141         z += details::PX6expf;
00142         z *= x2;
00143         z += x + 1.0f;
00144 
00145         /* multiply by power of 2 */
00146         z *= details::uint322sp((n + 0x7f) << 23);
00147 
00148         if (initial_x > details::MAXLOGF)
00149             z = std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity();
00150         if (initial_x < details::MINLOGF)
00151             z = 0.f;
00152 
00153         return z;
00154     }

00160     void fast_expv(const uint32_t size, double const* __restrict iarray,
